intro: Microglossa griffithii, commonly known as the Kashmir stonecrop, is a small, succulent plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, often blue-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
